thread.title: Local Roundup: Yellowjackets' sting takes control of SJAA race
thread.title_full: Local Roundup: Yellowjackets' sting takes control of SJAA race

author: The Record
title: Local Roundup: Yellowjackets' sting takes control of SJAA race
text: Posted Oct. 14, 2015 at 12:01 AM By The Record Posted Oct. 14, 2015 at 12:01 AM » Social News STOCKTON – Allowing an early goal didn't rattle the Franklin boys soccer team. It motivated them. After visiting McNair took the lead, the Yellowjackets quickly came back, taking control of the match and the San Joaquin Athletic Association race with a 4-1 win at Verner Field. The teams came into the match tied for first place in the SJAA. Franklin improved to 10-3-2 overall and 5-1-0 in the SJAA. The Yellowjackets own a one-game lead and hold the tiebreaker because they've defeated the Eagles (6-5-0, 4-2-0) both times they've played. “It was a very important match, and they have a very good team,” Franklin coach Richard Rodriguez said. “I like the way we responded when we had to.” Jorge Cardenas scored on a free kick to give the Eagles a 1-0 advantage in the 15th minute. Yellowjackets captain Miguel Acosta scored the first of his two goals on a cross from Andres Rayo a short time later to tie the match, and Benjamin Figueroa gave Franklin the lead for good. “Our coach told us that this is for first place, and we had to go out and represent the school," said Acosta, who also had an assist. Luis Rodriguez and Acosta pushed Franklin’s lead to 4-1 in the first 10 minutes of the second half, and the Eagles became frustrated. There was a confrontation with the officials which resulted in three McNair players being handed red cards. McNair coach Chris Hauschildt said there was no excuse for his players losing their cool, but did criticize the officials' performance and attitude. “Those refs were not very good. And (one of the officials) said that we are the most disrespectful team he’s ever reffed, which is not true,” Hauschildt said. “There were things that went on early that were let go. I don’t defend what (the red-card players) did at all. But those refs were disrespectful to our captain and players.” — By Scott Linesburgh, Record Staff Writer Edison 5, Stagg 1 At Edison, Saul Araiza had one goal and two assists and Gonzalo Andrade and Agustin Guerrero each had one goal and one assist for the Vikings (5-10-1, 4-2-0 SJAA). Martin Torres and Julian Andrade each had one goal for Edison. Joel Alvarez scored for the Delta Kings (7-6, 2-4). GIRLS VOLLEYBALL Edison 3, Franklin 0 At Franklin, the Vikings swept the rival Yellowjackets 25-14, 25-12, 25-17. For Edison (3-2 SJAA), Angie Avila had 21 digs, Kaelynne Mendoza had 17 assists and Katy Vega went on a nine-point serving run. Chavez 3, Stagg 0 At Chavez, the Titans (11-8, 5-0 SJAA) remained unbeaten in league with a 25-22, 25-13, 25-23 win over the Delta Queens. For Chavez, Lillian Willis had 25 digs, Kayla Horn had 18 service points, and Valerie Fernandez had six kills. Bear Creek 3, McNair 0 At Bear Creek, the Bruins (9-8, 4-1 SJAA) swept the rival Eagles 25-21, 25-15, 25-7 as Destiny Williams had 17 kills, Mia Kahler had 32 assists and Danielle Cochrane had five aces. Second-place Bear Creek plays at first-place Chavez at 6 p.m. Thursday. GIRLS WATER POLO Bear Creek 19, McNair 8 At McNair, Jenna Collins scored seven goals, Sydney Marino had four goals and goalie Jannie Ford recorded 11 saves as the Bruins (10-8, 4-0 SJAA) defeated the Eagles (12-3, 3-1). Diamond Tennis had five goals and Kassandra Cavender had two goals for McNair. BOYS WATER POLO Bear Creek 22, McNair 9 At McNair, Dalin Nelson and Jack Stensland each scored six goals as the Bruins (11-6, 4-0 SJAA) beat the Eagles (4-8, 2-2). Leo Carrillo had three goals and Nick Snyder had two goals for McNair. By The Record
